alert.note: Alert for Northern Blue Mountains of Oregon (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Pendleton (Northeast Oregon and Southeast Washington)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued March 24 at 10:10AM PDT until March 25 at 5:00AM PDT by NWS Pendleton
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 AM PDT SATURDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow. Additional snow accumulations of 4 to 8 inches above 4500 feet, 2 to 3 inches below 4500 feet. Total snow accumulations of 14 to 18 inches above 4500 feet. * WHERE...In Oregon, Northern Blue Mountains of Oregon. In Washington, Northwest Blue Mountains. * WHEN...Until 5 AM PDT Saturday. * IMPACTS...Motorists should be prepared for winter driving conditions across the Blue Mountain passes, especially at night and early in the morning during this multi-day event. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow totals will be lighter below 4500 feet, with heaviest snow from Tollgate to Ski Bluewood.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions can be obtained for Oregon by calling 5 1 1 or by visiting online at https://tripcheck.com, or for Washington by visiting online at https://wsdot.com/travel.
